bug.short_desc: Broken dependencies: koji-containerbuild depends on python2-* packages
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: koji-containerbuild has broken dependencies in the rawhide tree which I'm notified automatically by e-mails.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): koji-containerbuild-0.6.3-2.2.fc25
How reproducible: Always
Additional info: I get these e-mails on daily basis:
Subject: Broken dependencies: koji-containerbuild From: buildsys@fedoraproject.org To: koji-containerbuild-owner@fedoraproject.org
koji-containerbuild has broken dependencies in the rawhide tree: On x86_64: koji-containerbuild-builder-0.6.3-2.2.fc25.noarch requires python2-dockerfile-parse koji-containerbuild-builder-0.6.3-2.2.fc25.noarch requires python2-pycurl koji-containerbuild-builder-0.6.3-2.2.fc25.noarch requires python2-urlgrabber On i386: koji-containerbuild-builder-0.6.3-2.2.fc25.noarch requires python2-dockerfile-parse koji-containerbuild-builder-0.6.3-2.2.fc25.noarch requires python2-pycurl koji-containerbuild-builder-0.6.3-2.2.fc25.noarch requires python2-urlgrabber On armhfp: koji-containerbuild-builder-0.6.3-2.2.fc25.noarch requires python2-dockerfile-parse koji-containerbuild-builder-0.6.3-2.2.fc25.noarch requires python2-pycurl koji-containerbuild-builder-0.6.3-2.2.fc25.noarch requires python2-urlgrabber Please resolve this as soon as possible.
koji-containerbuild-0.6.6-3.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-335c2e3c62
koji-containerbuild-0.6.6-3.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-2afd497833
koji-containerbuild-0.6.6-3.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-3b65173134
koji-containerbuild-0.6.6-3.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-9ef742e8fc

koji-containerbuild-0.6.6-3.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-2afd497833
